result.execSummary:
The defendant Clay E Rich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED - Huber with standard release conditions
IF REVOKED 44 days credit and will be concurrent to any other current sentence
Concurrent with: any other current sentence

miscConds.notes:
*Cash bail previously posted applied towards court costs. Balance of court costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
*If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent
*No contact with the Pick-N-Save store listed in the criminal complaint
*Take thinking for a change course

11:22 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clay E Rich in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Clay E Rich.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed on the document.  Atty. Hughes confirms the offer also noting that the repeater enhancer will be struck as well.  State confirms.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 with the repeater enhancer struck.  Court orders Counts 2-4 dismissed and read in.  Defendant may be returned to the facility he is currently being held at.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Nicklolie, and notes her office is in compliance with victim rights.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Hughes.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
9 Months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS (44 Days Credit IF revoked and imposed - will also be concurrent to any other current sentence). 

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-       No contact with the Pick-N-Save store listed in the Criminal Complaint;
-	Take Thinking for a Change Course.

COSTS:  $268.00;

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Court to apply the $100.00 Cash Bail on deposit; remainder to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by Atty. Hughes.
Warrant signed by Judge Lau canceled on 8-25-22
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Detainer placed at: Washington County Jail on 8-25-22

THE DEFENANT ALREADY POSTED $100 CASH BAIL AND NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $150.00.
Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save in Menomonee Falls listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:46 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.Defendant Clay E Rich appeared by Zoom, in custody Washington County Jail.  Attorney Steven Hughes appeared by Zoom for Clay E Rich. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCED FROM THE WASHINGTON COUNTY JAIL FOR THE NEXT APPEARANCE.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:17 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Cassandra Miller, for attorney Steven Hughes, in court.   Defendant Clay E Rich did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charles Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Miller notes that the defendant contacted Atty. Hughes yesterday to advise he would not be able to appear today due to an illness.  State requests a capias be issued.  Atty. Miller requests the capias be stayed until the next court date.  Court will issue but stay the capias as long as the defendant provides proof regarding his absence today within the next 7 days.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for April 29, 2022.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save in Menomonee Falls listed in the Criminal Complaint.

03:06 PM Defendant Clay E Rich in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Defense is requesting a $200.00 cash bond or in the alternative, Huber Bailee status.
Arguments by the State.  
For the reasons stated on the record the Court orders cash bail modified down to $100.00.  All conditions remain as previously set.
Hearing set for 4/22/22 to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.
Bail/bond hearing on February 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bail
Hearing on April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:19 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clay E. Rich in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant wishes to address bail and Attorney Hughes requests a date as soon as possible.  The Court will schedule the next available date before the Trial court and defense to file a bail motion so a sooner date may be scheduled.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
